sections.heading: How to taper, reduce, or discontinue
sections.summary: For those on a higher dose and/or longer term opioids there is an increased potential for more challenges to tapering, including withdrawal symptoms. subsections.heading: Onset and duration of withdrawal symptoms

sections.summary: Opioid withdrawal can be very uncomfortable and difficult for the patient and can feel like a very bad flu. Opioid withdrawal is not usually life-threatening. Onset: ~6–24 hours after last useDuration: ~3–10 days Onset: ~12–72 hours after last useDuration: ~10–20 days

sections.heading: Tapering plan and follow-up visits
sections.summary: This form is designed to help primary care providers document the tapering plan agreed upon by both the patient and the primary care provider. Ensuring the patient has been part of the planning process is important for buy-in and adherence to the agreed upon plan. Have the patient repeat the plan back to you to ensure that they understand it.
